Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Park Slope Fifth Avenue business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the Park Slope Fifth Avenue BID.

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Park Slope Fifth Avenue business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the Park Slope Fifth Avenue BID.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Bryant Park Business Improvement District that provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge in the Bryant Park Business Improvement District is based.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amending the district plan of the Bryant Park BID to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Bryant Park Business Improvement District that provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge in the Bryant Park Business Improvement District is based.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amendment Proposed by Comm
Items.MatterName: Amending the district plan of the Bryant Park BID to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Bryant Park Business Improvement District that provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge in the Bryant Park Business Improvement District is based.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Amended by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amending the district plan of the Bryant Park BID to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Bryant Park Business Improvement District that provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge in the Bryant Park Business Improvement District is based.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amending the district plan of the Bryant Park BID to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to amend the New York State Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law to reduce State-imposed financial mandates on off-track betting corporations which have recently been absorbing a growing portion of the New York City Off-Track Betting Corporation’s revenues, driving the corporation into insolvency, and yielding no residual revenues for the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York State Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to amend the New York State Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law to reduce State-imposed financial mandates on off-track betting corporations which have recently been absorbing a growing portion of the New York City Off-Track Betting Corporation’s revenues, driving the corporation into insolvency, and yielding no residual revenues for the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York State Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law.
